DOC.brief_summary: This study will prospectively evaluate a new electrosurgical procedure (bipolar transurethral prostatectomy) in men with symptomatic benign prostatic hyperplasia.
DOC.brief_title: Bipolar vs Monopolar Transurethral Resection of the Prostate (TURP)
DOC.detailed_description: The purpose of this study is to demonstrate that the Bipolar TURP using the Vista Controlled Tissue Resection System is safe and efficacious as a surgical treatment for men with symptomatic BPH, allowing a reduction in the post-operative hospitalization. It is expected that bipolar TURP will be safe and efficacious for the surgical treatment of BPH and will allow a < 24 hour post-operative hospital stay in > 50% of patients undergoing this procedure.
DOC.criteria: Symptomatic benign prostatic hyperplasia including patients with acute urinary retention; Peak urinary flow rate < 12 ml/sec; American Urological Association (AUA) symptom score > 12. Previous open or transurethral prostatic surgery; History of urethral stricture; Failure to discontinue alphaadrenergic blocking agents for at least 14 days prior to surgery; Failure to discontinue 5alpha reductase inhibitor for at least 1 month prior to surgery; Patient interested in future fertility; Patient with known neurogenic bladder dysfunction; Untreated urinary tract infection; American Society of Anesthesiologist (ASA) Class >III; Patients requiring anticoagulation with Coumadin or Heparin; Patient unable or unwilling to comply with followup schedule.
